website_summaries.verdict: Asus was one of the first PC makers to go ultra-thin with its Zenbook line. That latest UX301 version packs in nearly every high-end spec you'd want, but it's priced out of reach for most, and lacks an all-day battery.
pros: The Asus Zenbook UX301 packs in a lot, including a better-than-HD touch screen, big 256GB SSD, and Core i7 processor, in a slim, smart design
cons: It costs more than most comparable better-then-HD laptops, including the Retina MacBook Pro
The Zenbook doesn't feel as rugged as its price warrants, and its battery life is unimpressive

customer_reviews.title: Just like everyone else the SSD has failed
customer_reviews.text: I have erased my review in interest of future customers to help prevent them from buying a faulty product that will not be addressed by the company. Like many others my hard drive has failed as my product right after my laptop was out of warranty. Asus quoted me 690$ to fix the issue(half of what you can buy the laptop for now). Keep away from ASUS because they don't build a quality product for the price you pay and their customer service is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Willard

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING laptop.  This thing has more power than captain america!!!
customer_reviews.text: You want a good machine, HERE IT IS!!! Granted, i have only had this for a couple of weeks, but have used it constantly. I narrowed my decision down to this or the samsung ativ book 9. I am so happy i went this route. The speed, the look, the functionality, everything is perfect. The ONLY flaw is the semi sharp front edge on the machine, but i only feel it when slumping back with it on my lap, and even then, it doesn't shred my, its just a little uncomfortable over time. I would for sure buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brighamcitygirl

customer_reviews.title: It is an ASUS. What else do I need to say!
customer_reviews.text: What should I say. I always loved ASUS' products. Very good build quality. The style is so good. I loved the glasses they used on the three surfaces. It is so thin and light. But I hoped it can have more usb ports other than only two. The battery life is not amazing but fairly good. I have never been a Win8.1 fan, but it is not hard to use and feels better than my thought.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Bi

customer_reviews.title: Completely unreliable, BSOD, and Lots of Hard Drive Issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had this laptop for just over a year and as much as I wanted to love it, it has given me more issue than any other laptop I've ever owned. I've returned it to Asus every 4 months since owning it, and I am currently in need of returning it a 3rd time due to hard drive issues yet again. If they would have fixed it right the first time I probably would have given it a better review because when it works, it is a decent laptop, but Asus has failed to make it right.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Absolute perfection.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is too high res and some existing technologies/software still need to be optimized for such a device. Absolutely gorgeous at every angle and will impress you as soon as you get the box. This device is beautiful on a level that is unlike any other laptop I have ever seen on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Touch Screen Fails on Expensive Asus Zenbook U305
customer_reviews.text: I am a loyal Asus user. This Zenbook is my 9th Asus product. I also purchase computers for my job and am somewhat disappointed to say that this Zenbook's touchscreen has failed twice. Both times with the help of Asus customer support I was able to restore the computer to an earlier date and restore touchscreen functionality. For $1700 I really didn't anticipate this sort of poor software integration and failure of hardware to boot.(forgive the pun). I am giving the U301 one more chance to see if the updates have been corrected that apparently create the software/hardware snafu and cause the touchscreen to become disabled. Not pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Millington

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed for the price
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed for the price. Had a UA-31X prior and this falls way, way short. Keyboard is plastic and flimsy (delete key floats like it didn't fit in its setting), gets extremely hot along the bottom and speakers, and it feels fragile. Bought it a month before the 4ks were announced, and am almost convinced this was intended to be a shelf-filler that was ignored during Asus' R&D.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick Schleuning

customer_reviews.title: KERNAL_DATA_INPAGE_ERROR
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Asus UX301LA six months ago. Recently it began to blue-screen one or twice an hour with a KERNAL_DATA_INPAGE_ERROR. I believe the issue is related to power distribution and similar to what's documented here:
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence L

customer_reviews.title: Very good Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: Very good Windows 8.1 touch screen. Very fast, reliable and so far problem free. My only complaint is a minor one; the touch pad is very sensitive and difficult to adjust to my specific preferences. Touch pads on both the MacBook Pro and Toshiba Kirabook are supior in this regard, but otherwise the Zenbook is competitive with either, and has a slightly better price point.
customer_reviews.author: Danbury Steve

customer_reviews.title: My tab key broke. Asus tech support required repeated ...
customer_reviews.text: My tab key broke. Asus tech support required repeated efforts to contact them. I called in and have an RMA and am sending this back. This is a significant inconvenience to my work. We paid top dollar and expected a quality product that failed at a basic level. Will update this as things are repaired.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This ultrabook is simply beautiful, the screen resolution is really crisp and the performance its outstanding, The wireless card has some problems, some times I need to restart the laptop to get it going, but everything else its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: Owned for 2 weeks now and love it awesome built quality, stellar screen, very fast and the best part its beautiful !! definitely cost alot but well worth it! My only con would be the space-bar makes alot more noise and feels little different then rest of the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Palmer

customer_reviews.title: The first unit shipped had a defect but the second ...
customer_reviews.text: The first unit shipped had a defect but the second unit works quite well. I do give Amazon a rave review for the diligence in the advanced return process. Place the RMA request at 2pm on a Friday and the replacement unit was in my hands by noon on Saturday.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Duval

customer_reviews.title: SSD Problem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this computer Based on reviews. Within 2 days the system would not boot to windows and one of the Sandisk SSD drives would not show in the BIOS. I returned it to amazon and ordered a replacement the new one worked for 4 months and now has the same problem. The computer Looks Feels and runs Great when in works but i cannot afford to loose my personal data every four months.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Light portable and quick. Used mostly for gaming and no complaings
customer_reviews.author: Dale F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Light and powerful. Would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fouad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The best laptop I've ever owned, hands down. I switched from a Vaio Duo 13, was worried I'd miss the tablet form, but this device is truly in a league of its own.
customer_reviews.author: heuristik

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The better computer I've ever had in terms of functionality, but in this case, you got beauty in addition.
customer_reviews.author: luisg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great job Asus! The problem is the windows 8.1 and his bugs. But I am very satisfied with this new ultrabook!
customer_reviews.author: Igor Drews

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but a great machine.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been complaining about her slow and heavy laptop for quite a while. This laptop is a real joy in that it is super fast and lightweight. I believe that SSD's will shortly replace hard drives as the capacity increases and the cost comes down.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Bear

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: the lower right side of the keyboard has a crack within a month . Do not understand
customer_reviews.author: yuran fu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Asus Zenbook is the best notebook I've already had. It's up all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Tedeschi Barone

customer_reviews.title: 256gb version
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month and I have nothing negative to say about it. Windows 8.1 is a little finicky (bluetooth) but the hardware itself is top of the line. Everyone loves how it looks and works. Crazy fast!
customer_reviews.author: Hector Arambula

customer_reviews.title: Computer hard drive died in a little over a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Computer hard drive died in a little over a year. Impossible to find a repair vendor who can fix it. Evidently, the hard drive use a special adaptor that no one has. DON'T BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: kimit

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great laptop. Bought it for my daughter. She loves and treasures it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: five stars
customer_reviews.text: Asus standard as a quality pc. Great buy and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lectures
customer_reviews.text: Excellent laptop. Amazingly portable and perfect for students I use it everyday. I got it refurbished and have not found a single problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel MacFarlane

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that would make this laptop better would be an OLED display, and the InstantOn Asus software causes Windows 8.1 resolution to reset, which can be resolved by disabling that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Scott Davies

customer_reviews.title: Specifications are great in theory
customer_reviews.text: Its essentially a turd covered in gold. I'm on my second RMA because of hardware failures. Specifications are great in theory, but when its failing within 6 months twice in a row it leaves much to be desired. If I could go back in time I would not buy this product and if this is the ASUS "premium" line its a huge embarrassment to the company. I enjoyed the product while it worked, but a chief requirement of a laptop is to work. I will not be purchasing an ASUS product ever again as this experience has left a sour taste in my mouth. It would take a lot to get me back as a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had two hard drive crashes in the first 18 months!
customer_reviews.author: Terri King

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super thin can run hot under intense processing elegant design, perfect powerful lightweight laptop.
customer_reviews.author: MMX

customer_reviews.title: light and cool! Best laptop for me Pick this
customer_reviews.text: So fast, slim, light and cool! Best laptop for me Pick this!
customer_reviews.author: Sim Woogyeom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Display!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing for the most expensive 13" Ultrabook in market! There is obviously something wrong with the display! The display's calibration is off!Unfortunately i had to return it!
customer_reviews.author: ealy

customer_reviews.title: It did not work properly.
customer_reviews.text: The screen change brightness on its own. It halted when I updated Windows 8 to Windows 8.1. I paid $70 to return it with insurance. It wasted my time to test it and reported the bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Hui Ma

product_meta.title: ASUS Zenbook UX301LA-DH71T Laptop (Windows 8.1, Intel Core i7-4558U, 13" LED-lit Screen, Storage: 256 GB, RAM: 8 GB) Blue
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
UX301LA-DH71T. Blue. Touch Screen. 13.3" WQHD (25601440), glossy. Intel Core i7-4558U 2.8Ghz (Turbo 3.3GHz) Haswell. 8GB DDR3L (1600MHz) on board. Intel UMA HD5100. 128GB SSD + 128GB SSD RAID. No Optical Drive. Windows 8 (64bit). 802.11AC. HD Camera. Bluetooth 4.0. illuminated Backlit. 50WHrs, 4560mAh, 3S2P, 6-cell Li-ion Polymer Battery Pack up to 8 hours. 1YR International/1YR Accidental Damage/30-Day Zero Bright Dot/2-way FREE shipping/24-7 tech support
feature_bullets: Intel Core i7-4558U. 8GB DDR3L. 8-hour battery life
256GB Sata III flash storage (RAID 0 for speed)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars110 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
